content:
StyleCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of Style objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public class StyleCollection : System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection
  • StyleCollection

Remarks

Use the StyleCollection class to store and manage Style objects for a control. Control developers can use this class to contain a set of styles that apply to different portions of the control.

The collection dynamically increases in size as objects are added. Indexes in this collection are zero-based. Use the Count property to determine how many objects are in the collection.

Additionally, use the StyleCollection methods and properties to provide the following functionality:

  • The Add method to add a single style to the collection.

  • The Insert method to add a style at a particular index within the collection.

  • The Remove method to remove a style from the collection.

  • The RemoveAt method to remove the style located at a particular index.

  • The Contains method to determine whether a particular style is already in the collection.

  • The IndexOf method to retrieve the index of a style within the collection.

  • The Clear method to remove all the styles from the collection.

Properties summary

Item(Int32)

Gets the Style object at the specified index location in the StyleCollection object.

Methods summary

Add(Style)

Appends a specified Style object to the end of the StyleCollection object.
Contains(Style)

Determines whether the specified style is contained within the collection.
CopyTo(Style[],Int32)

Copies the elements of the StyleCollection to a one-dimensional Style array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
CreateKnownType(Int32)

Creates an instance of the Style class, based on the single element collection returned by the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.GetKnownTypes* method.
GetKnownTypes()

Gets an array of the IStateManager types that the StyleCollection can contain.
IndexOf(Style)

Returns the index of the specified Style object within the collection.
Insert(Int32,Style)

Inserts a specified Style object into the StyleCollection at the specified index location.
Remove(Style)

Removes the specified Style object from the StyleCollection object.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the Style object at the specified index location from the StyleCollection object.
SetDirtyObject(Object)

Instructs the input Style object contained in the collection to record its entire state to view state, rather than recording only change information.

Properties

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets the Style object at the specified index location in the StyleCollection object.

    public System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style this[int i] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • i
      Int32

      The zero-based index location of the Style object in the StyleCollection.

    Property Value

    • Style

      A Style object at the specified index in the StyleCollection.

    Remarks

    Use this indexer to access a Style object from the StyleCollection at the specified index, using simple array notation. The indexer allows you to modify or replace a Style object in the collection directly.

Methods

  • Add(Style)

    Appends a specified Style object to the end of the StyleCollection object.

    public int Add (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style);

    Parameters

    • style
      Style

      The Style object to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index at which the style was added to the collection.

    Remarks

    Use the Add method to append the specified Style object to the end of the StyleCollection object.

    To add a Style object to the collection at a specific index location, use the Insert method.

  • Contains(Style)

    Determines whether the specified style is contained within the collection.

    public bool Contains (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style);

    Parameters

    • style
      Style

      The Style to locate within the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the style is in the collection; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The Contains method determines equality by using the Equals method on the Style objects.

  • CopyTo(Style[],Int32)

    Copies the elements of the StyleCollection to a one-dimensional Style array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

    public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style[] styleArray, int index);

    Parameters

    • styleArray
      Style[]

      The Array that is the destination of the copied styles. The Array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in styleArray at which copying begins.

    Remarks

    The style elements are copied to the Array object in the same order in which they are indexed within the StyleCollection object.

  • CreateKnownType(Int32)

    Creates an instance of the Style class, based on the single element collection returned by the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.GetKnownTypes* method.

    protected override object CreateKnownType (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index, from the ordered list of types returned by stem.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.GetKnownTypes*, of the type of the IStateManager object to create. Because the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.GetKnownTypes* method of StyleCollection returns a list with only one type, the input index is ignored.

    Returns

    • Object

      An instance of the Style class.

  • GetKnownTypes()

    Gets an array of the IStateManager types that the StyleCollection can contain.

    protected override Type[] GetKnownTypes ();

    Returns

    • Type[]

      An array containing one Type object for the Style class, which indicates that the StyleCollection can contain Style objects.

  • IndexOf(Style)

    Returns the index of the specified Style object within the collection.

    public int IndexOf (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style);

    Parameters

    • style
      Style

      The Style to locate within the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the first occurrence of style within the collection; otherwise, -1 if the style is not in the collection.

    Remarks

    The Contains method determines equality by using the Equals method on the Style objects.

  • Insert(Int32,Style)

    Inserts a specified Style object into the StyleCollection at the specified index location.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index location at which to insert the Style object.

    • style
      Style

      The Style object to insert into the collection.

    Remarks

    Use the Insert method to insert a specified Style object into the StyleCollection object at a specified index location.

    To add a Style object at the end of the StyleCollection object, use the Add method.

  • Remove(Style)

    Removes the specified Style object from the StyleCollection object.

    public void Remove (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style style);

    Parameters

    • style
      Style

      The Style object to remove from the collection.

    Remarks

    Use the Remove method to remove the specified Style object from the StyleCollection object. All items that follow the Style object are then moved up to fill in the vacant position. The indexes of the moved items are also updated.

    To remove a Style object from the StyleCollection object at a specific index location, use the RemoveAt method. You can also remove every Style object in the collection using the Clear method.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes the Style object at the specified index location from the StyleCollection object.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index location of the Style object to remove.

    Remarks

    Use the RemoveAt method to remove the Style object at a specified index location from the StyleCollection object. All items that follow that Style object are then moved up to fill in the vacant position. The indexes of the moved items are also updated.

    To remove a specific Style object from the StyleCollection object, use the Remove method. You can also remove every Style object in the collection using the Clear method.

  • SetDirtyObject(Object)

    Instructs the input Style object contained in the collection to record its entire state to view state, rather than recording only change information.

    protected override void SetDirtyObject (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      Object

      The Style object that should serialize itself completely.
